titleStmt.title: J. H. Myers et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4260

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
We the undersigned members of the Jury who tried John Cosden on a charge of Larceny, Recommend him to an Executive pardon.
Louisville Octo. 29. 1863 --

J. H. Myers for
M. Billing
C. Henry Finck
Jas Hughs
L. P. Garrett
I hereby certify that the names of these persons herein named were jurors in the case of Jno Cosden indicted as Jno Crosby in Jefferson Circuit Ct

Jas P Chambers
by Lee Chambers D C
We the undersigned neighbors and acquaintances of John Cosdon ask your Excellency to pardon him.

J. E. Littrell
W. H. Page
John Jameson
Clinton Pearce
John Bell
Marshall Jameson
Enos Sutton
Capt McDowell
James Cyer
W P townsend
J. R. Chambers
M Boston
Henry J Smith
M Flanigan
S Piogee
J Varbele
H C Russell
George Jackson
Wallim Wadll
Thomas O Hawes
H. W. Watson
L. T. Smith
Wm Mullikin
James L. Turner (Watchman, made the arrest)
James Kirkpatrick (Ex-Chief of Police)
Baird & Price (attos at Law --
A A Hickering
J T Sheppard
John OConnor
Pink Varble
Wm William
Alexr Mackay
John Odell
James Gray
Thomas J Muir
D. W. Rowland
Ben G Harris
W. H. McClish
J T Thatcher
Jas Weles

Jefferson County
Cosdens Pet for Pardon
Refused
Tho E Bramlette
